data.title: LaGuardia Airport AirTrain Abandoned for Better Bus Services
data.meta_description: New York Governor Kathy Hochul, who paused the AirTrain in 2021, drops $2 billion project after panel recommendation
data.text:
The $2 billion AirTrain project, which would have connected Midtown Manhattan to LaGuardia Airport, is dropped following a report by an expert panel released Monday that called for improved bus service.

New York Governor Kathy Hochul , who paused the LaGuardia AirTrain project in 2021, embraced the report’s recommendation calling for better bus service in place of the project. She had asked the The Port Authority of New York & New Jersey, the airport’s operator, to study alternative mass transit options to LaGuardia at the time.
